docs.title: About plugin
docs.text: This product is a plugin for Unreal Engine that allows you to customize various settings and features of the engine in game. You can change the graphics API, enable or disable ray tracing, nanite, global illumination, shadows, reflections, anti-aliasing, and other post-process effects. You can also switch between different shader models and feature levels to optimize your game performance. This plugin gives you more control and flexibility over the visual quality and performance of your Unreal Engine projects.

docs.title: Links
docs.text:
Video Showcase Get UE5 Plugin Get UE4 Plugin

OBS: If you have downloaded the free version for Unreal Engine 4, consider purchasing the plugin after finishing the project!

docs.title: Welcome to documentation
docs.text: Fortnite has certain options to change the graphic API and Feature Levels. There was no way to change them via blueprint and have it work in-game. The EngineUserSettings plugin was created so that you can change and save these options in the easiest way possible.

docs.title: Finding nodes
docs.text:
• 1- Click with right mouse button to open BP search box.
  • 2- Scroll down until you find the EngineUserSettings section.

docs.title: 1- Set Prefered RHI
docs.text:
• Change between DX11, DX12 or VULKAN.
  • OBS: Game need to be restarted to take effect.

docs.title: 2- Get Prefered RHI
docs.text: • Gets the RHI that will be used when the game is restarted.

docs.title: 3- Get Current RHI
docs.text: • Get current RHI.

docs.title: 4- Set Preferred Feature Level
docs.text:
• Change between SM5, SM6 and Performance Mode.
  • OBS: UE5 only.

docs.title: 5- Get Preferred Feature Level
docs.text:
• Gets the Shader Model that will be used when the game is restarted.
  • OBS: UE5 only.

docs.title: 6- Get Current Feature Level
docs.text:
• Get current Shader Model.
  • OBS: UE5 only.

docs.title: 7- Get Max Feature Level
docs.text:
• Get max supported Shader Model by hardware.
  • OBS: UE5 only.

docs.title: 8- Set GI Method
docs.text:
• Change Global Illumination method Lumen, SSR, Raytraced, None.
  • OBS: UE5 only.

docs.title: 9- Get GI Method
docs.text:
• Get Global Illumination method.
  • OBS: UE5 only.

docs.title: 10- Set SSGI Quality
docs.text: • Set Screen Space Global Illumination quality.

docs.title: 11- Get SSGI Quality
docs.text: • Get Screen Space Global Illumination quality.

docs.title: 12- Set Reflection Method
docs.text:
• Change reflection method Lumen, SSR, Raytraced, None.
  • OBS: UE5 only.

docs.title: 13- Get Reflection Method
docs.text:
• Get reflection method.
  • OBS: UE5 only.

docs.title: 14- Set SSR Quality
docs.text: • Change Screen Space Reflection Quality.

docs.title: 15- Get SSR Quality
docs.text: • Get Screen Space Reflection Quality.

docs.title: 16- Set Shadow Method
docs.text:
• Change shadow method Shadow Map, Virtual Shadow Maps.
  • OBS: UE5 only.

docs.title: 17- Get Shadow Method
docs.text:
• Get Shadow Method.
  • OBS: UE5 only.

docs.title: 18- Set AA Method
docs.text: • Change Antialiasing method None, FXAA, MSAA, TAA, TSR.

docs.title: 19- Get AA Method
docs.text: • Get Antialiasing method.

docs.title: 20- Set MSAA Quality
docs.text: • Change MSAA quality.

docs.title: 21- Get MSAA Quality
docs.text: • Get MSAA quality.

docs.title: 22- Set Ambient Occlusion
docs.text: • Enable or disable Ambient Occlusion.

docs.title: 23- Get Ambient Occlusion
docs.text: • Get if Ambient Occlusion is enabled or disabled.

docs.title: 24- Set Bloom
docs.text: • Enable or disable Bloom.

docs.title: 25- Get Bloom
docs.text: • Get if Bloom is enabled or disabled.

docs.title: 26- Set Lens Flare
docs.text: • Enable or disable Lens Flare.

docs.title: 27- Get Lens Flare
docs.text: • Get if Lens Flare is enabled or disabled.

docs.title: 28- Set Motion Blur
docs.text: • Enable or disable Ambient Occlusion..

docs.title: 29- Get Motion Blur
docs.text: • Get if Ambient Occlusion is enabled or disabled.

docs.title: 30- Set Nanite
docs.text:
• Enable or disable Nanite.
  • OBS: UE5 only.

docs.title: 31- Get Nanite
docs.text:
• Get if Nanite is enabled or disabled.
  • OBS: UE5 only.

docs.title: Setup your project
docs.text:
• 1- Go to Edit > Project Settings > Windows.
  • 2- Check the boxes under Targeted RHIs tab that you need.
  • 3- Make sure you are packaging your game using Shipping option.
